itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Glyn Moses (30 May 1928– 29 September 2021) was a Welsh rugby union and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Newbridge RFC and Maesteg RFC, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Great Britain, Wales, Other Nationalities, and Great Britain & France, and at club level for Salford and St. Helens, as a fullback, i.e. number 1.

response: *  Glyn Moses Wales and Great Britain rugby league international
* Glyn Moses (1928–2021), Welsh rugby union, and rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s
